block.p: Several American Indian tribes are seeking to create or expand basic telephone service, a necessary step to increase Internet access on native lands, and the Mescalero Apache tribe of southern New Mexico has now become the latest to form its own telephone company.

One factor contributing to this trend has been that the Federal Communications Commission is making more funds available to tribally-owned phone companies, since the telephone penetration rate has been only 47 percent among Indian households, compared with 94 percent of the general population.
